title: Homemade rye crackers
time: Hands-on time 15 min, oven time 20 min
description: The perfect accompaniment to a cheeseboard, these easy-to-make rye crackers can be scaled up in batches to serve as many as needed.
ingredients: 150g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
4 tbsp olive oil, plus extra to brush
3 tbsp mixed seeds (such as coriander, fennel and sesame)
2 baking sheets lined with non-stick baking paper

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Mix the flours and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre and pour in 145ml cold water and the4 tbsp olive oil. Use your hands to bring it together and form a dough, adding a little more water if needed.

method.Step 2: Tip the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly. Cut into10 pieces, then roll out each as thinly as possible into any shape you like.

method.Step 3: Transfer the crackers to the lined baking sheets, brush with a littleextra oil and sprinkle with mixed seeds and a grinding of black pepper.Bake for 7-8 minutes until golden and cooked to your liking (you’llneed to do this in batches). Transfer to a wire rack to cool and continue with the remaining dough.

method.Step 4: Break up the crackers to serve or put in food bags and keep in a cool place (see Make Ahead).
